text: The best aged angus burger fed on carrots..... the staff is awesome too.... can't wait to go back....
From out of town and visited on a whim. Incredible food, incredible service.  I wish there was a place like this back home!

Absolutely fabulous! Huge bar with I think about 40 beers on tap. Service was great and so were the happy hour apps we got. Definitely would go back and try a whole meal. Great new addition to downtown.

Came in on a Friday night around 6:40 pm, there was no wait and we got seated immediately. The server was very friendly and provided excellent customer service. 

The food was so delicious! I got their BBQ bacon burger with their signature fries, I was very happy with my meal. My boyfriend got the steak dip sandwich with Mac n cheese balls instead of fries, which of course I tried, it was a solid meal. Both meals had some bomb bread, which is the best part for me. I enjoyed everything we ordered and would come again!

The staff is friendly and greeted me promptly. The lighting and ambience is very welcoming. The chicken nachos are very flavorful but could be a little more spread around with the sauce. A lot of chips had nothing on them. Price was reasonable though could be a bigger portion. I like this place!

We were strolling the streets of Fremont and ended up on this row of bars. We were walking by to see which place spoke to us. As we got to the end of this one block we came across Eureka! and it seemed to look fun and inviting. Not to mention it was filled w/ people, unlike some of the other places we passed by. Typically if a place is busy, it's gotta be good right? 

We walked in and the hostess let us know the wait time. We asked if food could be served at the bar. Once we found out it could be, we attempted to find a place at the bar. As I looked around one of the bartender's, Ashley, raised her hand to get my attention. Once I saw this, she pointed to 2 open seats. As we sat down Ashley greeted us w/ a smile. She asked if it was our first time. When she found out it was our first time she welcomed us and thank us for coming in. That felt really nice because not many places instill that in hospitality staff now a days. 

When she asked if we wanted to drink, we both had no clue. I told Ashley I wasn't much of a beer drinker, so I didn't know more than half that was on the list. I saw that their whiskey list was more my speed, but again there were some on there that I didn't know either. When we asked Ashley what a beer or whiskey tasted like, she was kind enough to take the time to drop some knowledge on us. 

In the end I said this is the type of beers and whiskeys I drink. Ashley said, I recommend these. She was spot on w/ her suggestions. We didn't end up eating here due change of plans, but we def would like to come back based off of how friendly Ashley was w/ our first time being there and newbies to so many of the drink options. That left a lasting impression on us.
Great happy hour specials on amazing food and drinks! Barry was an excellent server, too! Highly recommend!!

Solid addition to dt Las Vegas. A must see if visiting Freemont st. Whisky list is impressive. Burgers were really good with fig goat cheese bacon one the most memorable . Came back for brunch and the $5 bloody on weekend is an insane deal. I heard  there is Hawaiian off the menu burger. Need to check that out next time. 


                                                                             EDC ;)

The food was pretty good and the ambient was nice. We had some drinks and they were strong. I ordered the salmon and it was delicious. The restaurant seating are quute chic. This restaurant is located in the busy area of Fremont Street. There plenty of bars to go to after dinner here.

A great find for a local wanting to try something a little different than the typical Fremont Street Food....Just a short block away from the East entrance. Fun hip vibe with a live DJ, made this restaurant the perfect spot to escape the 109 degree heat!  Food was hands down some of the best I've had in awhile...fries were the bomb, and the Moscow Mules were perfectly homemade for a fun twist!  They did offer $5 mimosas and Bloody Mary's but we chose a mule. Everything was clean, even the restrooms. Only reason I gave a four star was because music was so loud we couldn't talk at all(was only 2pm so figured a lunch crowd would want to visit...Don't pass this one by the next time you are close to this area!

Went here for brunch today. The chilaquiles and chicken nachos were too salty. The chicken and cornbread were delicious. The prices were decent. I liked that they had a DJ spinning in the dining room.

Long time user of Yelp and this is my 1st and only post! I visit many old and new restaurants and I'm not a very picky critic, I can find something I like at mostly all places. I loved this new gem so much came in twice in 1 week! Cool room, Knowledgeable and attentive wait staff, Great apps, great cocktail and craft beer selection, and the most amazing juicy perfectly cooked restaurant burgers I've tasted as far back as I can remember! 5 Star for sure and highly recommended!

Heard wonderful things about this place and decided to stop by for dinner. They have a nice happy hour menu for food (mostly fried - delicious sounding thing) but I tried to keep it a little healthier... next time I will indulge !! The drinks for happy hour weren't a super good deal (I think $1 or $2 off) but better than nothing? We had a server in training so he was very attentive (and it was pretty dead in there @ 530pm on a Monday) The interior is dark and rustic but there is an outdoor patio if you want more light (and to sweat!!) I ended up ordering the chicken tacos which were good and super stuffed to the brim. They were $12 AND came with a side! I chose the sweet potato fries which came drizzled with honey and cinnamon. I want to come back and try more!

My husband, daughter and I went here for brunch today and were so happy! We have a 15 month old and the staff were so accommodating to a child in their restaurant! They brought out fruit right away, which kept baby happy and allowed us to decide which beer to try. The food was fantastic and came out in a very timely manner! The only negative is there were no changing tables in the bathroom, so I had to change my daughter on the bathroom floor. I was fine with it, but I know a lot of parents would not be. Other than that, awesome place and we will definitely be back!

I loved this spot! The food was delicious and the mimosas were so good! Affordable and really chill/urban environment. Super friendly staff, and our waiter was really helpful and genuinely kind. Most definitely has become one of my favorite spots, I'll be back for sure!
Mayshawn is awesome! He was patient with me as I was ordering for my drunk friend. Thank you so much beavis you helped me get a friend home safe.
Our server was pleasant. The food was good but for lunch it's a bit two pricey for two people. Not a place that I would return to.

This place is awesome! Their cocktails are completely made from scratch - best whiskey sour I've ever had. The food was delicious. Our server was so friendly and welcoming! (I can't remember his name but he was the buff fellow with tattoos). We will be back for sure.

Thank you, Eureka restaurant, for hosting our daughter's Make a Wish celebration! Thanks for letting my daughter cook with the amazing chef. It was so fun. We also loved the excellent food, the drinks, and service!!!

Our first trip here. We ordered-bourbon, old-fashioned and a beer, with nachos and lollipop corn dogs(pictured). The food was good, service was mediocre to subpar. Our food came out before our beverages. Our server actually came back a second time and re-introduced himself and tried to take our drink order again. The restaurant was busy, but still did not seem THAT busy! My husband took two sips of the old-fashioned, and had to order a beer instead. Maybe things will improve after being open a little longer.
This is by far the best food in downtown Las Vegas. It is a new must go eatery. Don't wait, don't hesitate. Go eat at Eureka.

Great place to eat in old Vegas. They had a great cocktail list and list and I was excited to find a place with fresh tasty food. 
I ordered a dry aged burger - delicious!  We also shared the deviled eggs per a yelp review and the Mac and cheese balls. 
Also a good place to eat when enjoying hanging out in old Vegas.

OMG the food and beer are outstanding!  Our bartender Troy was so knowledgeable in regards to the beer and he made a mean cocktail! 

Cant wait to go back !
Ginger lime and a turmeric shot - This is my new Boilermaker!  Great place!!  Great healthful drinks!

Great new spot in DTLV. Lots of whiskey selections but definitely have other signatures cocktails. Make no mistake, this is an American whiskey bar first! Food choices are great! Had a few of their shareable bites, Corn Pops, Mac N cheese balls, sliders and their protein salad and very delicious! This will be a regular spot for sure. Oh, and they have brunch on Sundays with $5 Bloodys and Mimosas all day!

This is a new nugget on Fremont street. Love the theme Beers, Burgers, and Bourbon! Food is amazing! A MUST is the Fig and Bison burgers! Fried mac & cheese app is also an excellent choice too. I'm glad to see dtwn is thriving

I went to Eureka on their opening night as well as last night.  I love their beer selection and crafty drinks. To my understanding, they really focus on making great burgers but I have not had the pleasure to try them yet.
Ashley is absolutely amazing. I told her what kind of drinks I like and she suggested Young & in love as well as passionate from miles away. I love how she garnished my drinks with a flower. 
I will definitely return.

New hip American Pub Downtown. The perfect place for a Tarantino dialogue to happen, loud music, hip food, and drinks, all overlooking the world famous Fremont Street. 

I started with the spicy ribettes. They were juicy and spicy.

The ginger, lemon ale has a refreshing kick to get your good gut flora to manifest, or at least that is what my wife told me. 

Menu has a lot of choices. I finally settled on the bone marrow burger , very juicy and tasty. The burgers a regular people size, so if you look like me, get an appetizer.  The service was friendly and fast. Overall a good addition to the downtown vibe. 

Sadly, the great beer selection is wasted on me since I don't drink, but I hear it is awesome. 

It is loud so maybe, they should give out glow sticks at the front!! Just a suggestion.

Best burger and beer around the Fremont Street area. I got the BBQ bacon cheese Burger and my love had The Fresno Fig Burger with Sweet Potato fries. Next time we were told by our buff waiter to get the Bone Marrow Burger. Dude was funny as hell and could provide security if you needed it. Prices are a little high but every ingredient you can taste.

We had Kevin as a server and everything turned out delicious and we were served quickly. I wanted to try their delicious looking $5 mimosas (Saturday-Sunday-All Day) but management was responsible and wouldn't take a photo of my ID when I didn't have it with me. I got the Brussel sprout salad which what fantastic. It is difficult to find a good salad, it was finely grated with dates, candied pecans and a couple other delightful toppings with a sweet yet tart dressing. I substituted fish (tilapia) and it worked well! Marc got a breakfast burrito that was pressed in a panini and SO GOOD. Potatoes were seasoned to my liking (not too salty with cayenne in the mix) and when we asked for hot sauce it had some serious kick! Atmosphere was cute and people were friendly. Thank you!
Fantastic new place on Fremont!  From scratch menu is wonderful.  Avocado toast for Sunday brunch is great.  Service is top notch.

This place was on a list of food and bar selection for our company wide happy hour! Food was great and despite being a full house with the wild majority of us, our server was on point with EVERYTHING!

Thank you Ryan for being so amazing through all the chaos! You the real MVP!
Awesome food and drinks.  Hubby loved the whiskey tasting!  Great blackened fish tacos.  Hubby loved the bison burger.

I knew this place was going to be good when we sat down an saw the beer list. They have 40 beers on tap, plus tons of whiskey. They even had one of my favorite beers from home -Hangar 24 Orange Wheat. On a recommendation, we ordered the brussel sprouts (AMAZING!), and then the Bison Burger and the Fresno Fig Burger. We also opted to upgrade our fries, one to sweet potato fries, and one with truffle cheese sauce on the side. Everything was absolutely incredible. The Bison Burger has this incredible jalapeno bacon jam that is somehow sweet and not spicy at all. The sweet potato fries were glazed with honey (brilliant!) and the truffle cheese was to die for. The feta and fig marmalade combo on my fig burger was absolutely mouth watering! Both burgers were cooked to an impeccable medium. The service was fantastic -they were so helpful attentive, and they were super excited about the food they were serving. On their recommendation, we also ordered the bourbon barrel cake, which was very good. It did have a strange consistency for a cake that we weren't expecting, but it was still really good. No joke, though, the brussel sprouts were the real winner here. Overall, this place isn't cheap but it's well worth it.

After finding out there would be a long wait at the Thai restaurant near by, we stopped in here for a great surprise.  Great foods for both adults and kids.  Plenty of beer options too.  Friendly servers and a fun atmosphere.

Once again, I am glad to be off the strip.  Seriously, this place is worth a try for anyone staying downtown Vegas.  The location is great, and food was amazing (appetizers, the main course, the drinks - all of it), and the staff was incredibly polite!

I love the fact that the menu is diverse, but yet feels cohesive.  If you like farm to table, or a unique twist on americana, this should be on your list to try, and you can thank me later.

We have a friend that works downtown so we were recommended this place by him.. we were not disappointed! It started off with the owner/manager present at the host stand and made sure we had a table for 5 of us. From there, our server Tyler was extremely helpful with suggestions and anticipated our every need, without being suffocating. And the food!!! It was so good! We had the Mac and cheese bites, corn dog lollipops, steak French dip, and the fried chicken sliders... cannot recommend all of them enough. All around an incredible dinner!

I've been here four times and highly enjoyed it every time. One of my favorite restaurants around the corner from here is Carson kitchen, and this place is up there close to it. It's easy to get a table, great atmosphere, great service and the food is consistent and very good!

Yum! Reasonable prices for the area, we had the Mac & Cheese balls, Fig Burger, & Cowboy Burger, all great, and well presented. I also tried the ginger and lime craft soda, very refreshing! Good service!

Came here for the huge beer selection and great reviews.Well it lives up to the hype.Had some very fancy cocktails and the food was very good.The bartender was really sweet and gave excellent service from beginning to end.

Have been to Eureka! in the past, so figured we would check out this one out. Very fast service considering it being a Saturday night. As soon as we walked in we were seated. Our waitress was pretty friendly. We ordered the truffle fries, Mac N' Cheese balls and a cheese burger. Food was fine. A little disappointed with the truffle fries, they have changed it a little since we have been to Eureka. Overall everything was good and would come back again.

Love this place! This place is definitely a winner in DTLV. I've been here plenty of times since it opened.
Great atmosphere, music, excellent cocktails even better food and bar service is fantastic. This place is a must stop if you are in DTLV.

We came for brunch, and the staff was very nice! 
The mac n cheese balls were so yummy! 
Personally, I thought my bloody marry was pretty gross, and the French toast was pretty average. The chicken and corn bread was good tho!

The food was average but the indoor - outdoor seating was appealing. Large restaurant which can accommodate parties of any size and has an Americana menu with a little something for everyone. I split the Mac and cheese balls, Brussels sprouts, and falafel bites with a friend and appreciated that they have items to share on the menu as well as full entrees.

Thankyou Troy and Christine!
Great friendly service with amazing smiles!
The food and Craft beers are so good!
Ashley the bartender is the bomb.com! Their food and happy hour is fantastic!
Delicious, fresh food. The cocktails are amazing. I had the Chef's Martini and it was to die for. The atmosphere is upscale but casual.

Although I was upset to see my record store / cafe gone I did enjoy the new establishment. We were here for the happy hour and were able to taste several appetizers. The Mac & Cheese balls, truffle fries and chicken nachos. Everything was infused with great flavours. Barry our waiter was fantastic. Although, all the staff was very attentive to all tables and we saw several staff at our table. When I return to Vegas I will be back!

The place is nice and open, located on Fremont Street. The wait staff is friendly and helpful. I ordered the Bone Marrow Burger. I was asked how I like my burger, ordered it medium rare. It was delicious and perfectly cooked, juicy,and the bone marrow butter they drizzled on top was very tasty. I'm not a big burger fan but I really liked it. The price was reasonable. I will be back when the burger craving hits.

Came in right before close...on accident. Still served my friends & I. some fire food. The burgers were great..truffle fries were amazing and the fried mac n cheese balls were to write home to mom about...ill be back on my next visit.
Roy is the best waiter ever me and my husband love  his hospitality very nice ask for roy
This is a nice place great service and nice vibe very comfortable home foods. I loved the brunch and the menu has a lot of variety. I'll be back next Sunday for brunch again. Give them a try

I was stoked about this place before it even opened. We were very excited about the 40 beers on tap, the special cocktails, and the creative menu. We split the Mac N Cheese Balls, Crispy Glazed Brussel Sprouts (the sauce was amazing), the chicken nachos, and the fried chicken sliders. It was all delicious! We will definitely be back to try one of the NINE burgers. High five Eureka!

I was thoroughly impressed and surprised by Eureka and definitely recommend anyone to visit. A few friends and I planned to meeting for brunch this past weekend and one of them recommended we try Eureka. After reviewing the menu I wasn't really that impressed but based on the reviews decided to give it a shot anyways. To which i'm SO glad we did. 

I decided on the Fig & Goat Cheese Burger and although I'm not fond of figs, I love me some goat cheese and Eureka marries these two in holy matrimony. It was fantastically made, juicy and the fries were perfectly seasoned to compliment it. 

They also have $5 mimosas!

I had the Fresno Fig Burger and it was hands down the best burger I have ever had! All the different flavors worked so well together. The burger came with fries and what I assumed was fresh ketchup, which was also amazing. Great friendly staff!!

We have a Eureka in Boulder CO and this one in Vegas beats it hands down. Similar offerings but the setting, drinks and general vibe is outstanding.  The food is excellent and it is obvious that pride is at work here and we the customers are the benefactors. This another example of an excellent alternative away from the strip and in the real up and coming area near downtown Vegas.

What a great new addition to the Downtown area! Food was delicious and service was great and there is plenty of seating where you don't feel so cramped!

I had a Tumeric Nectar drink and it was so refreshing! The Sea-bass was cooked to perfection. I'm looking forward to trying them out for brunch!

This is a great addition to the Fremont East District! I had the French Toast and my friend had the Steak & Eggs. Both our plates were delicious and reasonably priced. The place just opened on Monday and staff was on top of their game. I do have to add though that their $5 dollar Mimosas and Bloody Mary's should honestly just be bottomless for $15 or $20. I waited over 5 minutes to just get a mimosa which I didn't really understand the wait. It's literally just OJ and Champagne. Also, the French toast was delicious but I can see people having an issue with the price. The Steak and Eggs were $14 and was a good portion but the French Toast was $12 and only came with 3 pieces. I was fine as I'm not a fan of an overload on food but I do feel like making this like a $9 or $10 plate would be a lot reasonable. Other than that, I do see myself coming here more often. The food, service and atmosphere are great!

This place has a really good vibe and great menu. I got the short rib burger and it was amazing. The perfect amount of spice and the flavor was on point. The drinks were good and came out in a decent amount of time. If you're looking for someplace to hang out and chill on Freemont Street with a good vibe definitely come here!

Friendly service, unique dishes. There were no leftovers! The sweet potato fries were like sweet potato pie, even without the honey drizzle. Mac and cheese balls--yum! Burger, salad, and tacos were all delicious as well.

Wow! From the atmosphere, the food (the classic burger), the cocktails (Electric Butterfly) and the amazing service from Dante, Eureka did us well! We came here on a Sunday afternoon with our newborn and had such an amazing time! We cannot wait to bring all of our friends here!

Rotating taps and a rotating whiskey list compliment an already extensive drink menu. The food is good. My favorite part about this bar/restaurant is the patio with great views of Fremont. Located across the street from Commonwealth, there is no shortage of interesting people watching to be had.
The short rib kimchi burger was super delicious and the brussel sprouts the same.  Sat outside to people watch was just fun.  Lots of beer, whiskey, and mixed.

Loved It! When in Vegas and you want an amazing meal away from the tourist this is your place. The drinks are creative, the food delicious and the atmosphere cozy and eclectic. This will be my go to spot from now on.

So a friend recommended this place and told me that the steak  salad was bomb. I thought steak in my salad? That sounds weird. Well I decided to go for it and I did not regret it the steak salad was really good. It comes with a vinegar dress and I was a pretty happy camper. The place is perfect for lunch if you work downtown.
I had the blackened fish tacos... fantastic. My wife had the chicken sliders... fantastic. Mac & cheese balls were the best I've ever had and the truffle fries were good, too.

Winners: Deep Dried Cauliflower with Bonita flakes, MAC and Cheese Arancini, Fig and Bacon burger, fried chicken sliders, service (waiter was great)

OK: drinks, although hand crafted and hand made ingredients, some of them a bit sweet, Brussels sprouts were a little hard and not crispy

Meh: music was a little loud, but bearable, parking

It's a 4.8 Star place for Vegas, nice addition to the neighborhood

Great food and atmosphere! The brunch only had a few items on it but I enjoyed the avocado toast. They did a great job with the bar decor. Mimosas are delicious and staff is friendly. Definitely worth checking out this new spot downtown!

This place is just what down town, LV NEEDED! the menu is cool the food was amazing! We tried two different salads and two appetizers . The nachos and the Brussel sprouts were so good! We had Roy as a server he was really welcoming and knew a lot about the elaborate drink menu. Also they have good wine! My one struggle with dtlv east Fremont is that none of the restaurants/bars have good wine... then eureka came in like... problem solved fam! Needless to say I'm a huge fan I would recommend this place to a friend and to yelp!
Had a cowboy burger. Was very good. Staff very polite. Beer selections are great just a little slow on delivery.

Found this place as i was driving downtown. I immediately decided to check it out. I was very impressed. The decor takes me back to new york in the soho district. I love the ambiance. I also was very pleased with my food. we got there at 5:50 and i thought oh no im going to miss happy hour but both our hostess and waiters were accommodating. They made sure we got our happy hour before the clock struck 6. The mac and cheese balls were good a little kick with a perfect crunch. The chicken sliders were soooooo good mash potatoes on the bottom bun with a slaw and aioli the chicken fried to a crispy and crunchy perfection! The truffle fries  ahhhhh they were yummy the cheese truffle sauce to dip them im was instantly on my radar. I am not an ipa drinker but my friend got two, the first one may have just converted me. I will be back there is just so much more to try!
I have never tried the fresno location. But I ate here on my last trip. And the service was fantastic the food was even better. And I will definitely go too my fresno location now too

We ended up at Eureka thanks to the lovely lack of service next door. Our group had been out at an even most of the afternoon and had stopped by and looked at the menu, before heading next door. Not that the menu didn't catch our eye, but we had a plan. We proceeded next door, where we didn't have a reservation for a nearly empty restaurant. They did proceed to seat us right away and that's where we remained for 30 minutes. No offer for cocktails, no "we will be right with you"..... nothing.  Needless to say our group of 6 got up and left. Let me say this before you read into a group of 6- we are all professionals, we were all ready to enjoy drinks, food and most have worked in the industry at one point so yes we treat staff with respect and tip.

So we left and walked up to Eureka! where we were immediately greeted by friendly staff and the GM who was more than happy to have us there. The place had a great vibe the minute you walked in, everyone was happy and enjoying themselves. Our waitress was at our table right away giving us drink recommendations. Within in 10 minutes drink no orders and food orders were placed. With in 30 minutes of walking in we were well into enjoying our meals and cocktails. 

Our cocktails were all great! Our food was equally good. We will be back and will recommend to our friends.

We had an absolute blast. Only went for drinks- had some fries while we were there. Whiskey flights, AWESOME tap selection, and I'd swear a drink for anyone's style. The Holy Smokes was DELICIOUS! The place has a super hipster vibe, but it's not overwhelming. I'll be following their tap lines to plan reasons to go back! All food looked good, we just didn't go hungry. Planning to have an appetite and update the review next time!!

We ordered the truffle fries and the chicken nachos. The fries were a little salty but good and i didn't eat the nachos. The service was friendly and good. The BEST part of the restaurant was the in house DJ. He played the BEST music ever.

Ordered: 
-Bone marrow burger - cooked medium
-Sweet potato fries
-Cauliflower bites

The burger was really good. The perfectly cooked burger patty was topped with a thin layer of delicious bone marrow butter. Sweet potato fries were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside (just how I like them). The cauliflower bites were perfectly seasoned. Would definitely recommend these items to any newcomers!

The food was great the service was awesome I totally love the decor my cocktail wild child was off the hook great selection of wine I love the happy hour the boots were nice and comfy my one and only complaint was the music was too loud a lot of these places that we go into downtown I love to go but my husband cannot stand the loud music so we never go back I think half of the bar should be blaring music like it is and maybe where the eating area is not as loud just saying otherwise I'd give you 5 stars
This is very good food. Great service clean. Manager was friendly. If you are on Fremont street do your self a favor. Best au jus I have ever had on a beef dip.

You know when you walk in to a place and you're like, 'Yes!' This is IT. Ambience. Check. Music. Check. Beer. Check plus. This is the place where you go, order a beer, taste it, and your eyes light up and you slap the table or bar, if you're having a night out. The customer service is top notch, and the environment is extra cozy. Make sure you try the brussel sprouts, yeah, brussel sprouts. No regerts. Look for Tyler, he'll steer you right.

Really can't say enough good things about Eureka.  Fantastic location (though parking may get difficult at times) and plenty of seating inside, outside, or at the bar.  Not many "bars" on this side of Fremont to just sit back and watch a game, so Eureka is a fantastic new option.  Beer selection s fantastic and rare at the same prices in the area.  They offer flights for about $2-3 per pour and samples as well.  The best part is the 10pm Happy Hour, everyday, even on weekends, which I hope never ends as tone of the better deals in the area.  Lots of $6-7 bite options and a few dollars off drinks.

We had the blackened tacos, bone marrow burger, and brussel sprouts off the Happy Hour Menu.  The brussel sprouts were very good and came out super quick.  Large but cut in half, so definitely shareable.  The bone marrow burger was just a good burger at medium rare.  Not really sure I could taste the bone marrow itself as it's in the sauce, but still a big burger and filling.  I liked that they had broccolini and salad as side options as well for only a $2 upcharge above the complimentary fries with the dish.  The tacos were really good and had great filling.  The sweet potato fries were the only disappointing part of the meal.  They came with cinnamon topping which did not go well with any of our dishes ordered.  They were too sweet and more of a dessert than a side.  Pro tip: try their spicy aioli.  Fantastic dipping sauce and made the meal.

Great beer and food.  Awesome service and bar seating.   Eureka is the best new spot downtown.  I will be back for late night Happy Hour and brunch for sure.

I dont usually venture to downtown often, but a trip to Eureka! has given me a reason to do so more now. 

Love the ambiance here and the place has a nice set up. My friend and I sat at the bar while we wait for our other friend to show up. This place has an extensive list of whiskeys and beers and a few cocktails. They also have rotating beers on taps and rotating whiskey list. 

I ordered an old fashioned, which was made well - strong and smooth. My friend ordered their electric butterfly - quite a pretty drink and tasted good as well. It came with a Sichuan flower that numbs your tongue and heightens your taste buds...fancy lol so you're supposed to eat the flower first before sipping your drink. 

For food, we tried their Brussel sprouts, chicken nachos, and short rib kimchi burger with sweet potato fries. All the dishes were delicious. The burger had great flavors and i highly recommend the brussel sprouts! Great service all around from the bartenders to the servers! I will be coming back for sure!

Great downtown restaurant with vibrant energy! The decor is fun and rustic. The rotating taps, bottles and whiskey are a nice touch. The apps like crunchy and creamy Mac n Cheese bites and Falafel bites were a perfect compliment to our featured cocktails - the Penicillin (smoked whiskey, ginger honey and lemon) and Industry Margarita. Definitely another date night success for our first visit, but not our last! Hey, their weekend brunch menu looks killer too.
Great new spot downtown really yummy food and great drinks you must try the drink with the buzz button sit outside and enjoy the people watching all around good time

Wow, I'm so happy we stumbled across the place during our recent Vegas visit. The food, ambiance, and service were all amazing and we can't wait to get back in there. Gia, our server, couldn't have been friendlier or more attentive. Her suggestions were on point. Ask for her section and trust her. She's a tremendous asset to this restaurant. We opted for the corn dog lollipops and Brussels sprouts appetizers. Both were fantastic, but the sprouts are truly something special. I was begging them for the recipe lol. The corn dog pops had a wonderfully light and extremely crunchy batter. For entrees we had burgers. The bone marrow burger is quite possibly the best burger I've ever put in my mouth. And I'm a fat boy who loves some burger. Perfectly cooked, juicy, with just the right amount of that decadent marrow to push it over the edge from good to exceptional. This restaurant alone is worth the trip if you're staying on the strip. Seriously can't stop thinking about that burger.....

Very happy with my trip to Eureka, drove all the way down from mountains edge to try it out and it was well worth the expedition. 

Got there in time for happy hour (awesome little bites for cheap!) so we threw down a couple drinks and some Brussels sprouts. The Brussels had a lemon kinda zest to them as opposed to the obvious idea of drenching it in balsamic so kudos for goin outside the box. I went out on a limb and tried the stone double IPA as well as a different DIPA that I can't remember, both incredulous. Let my hair down real hard. Btw these drafts, as well as the bottled beers and whiskeys rotate so you can always find a fresh lineup?? That's awesome. 

The entrees didn't stand a chance. Me and Mika both had burgers that were perfectly portioned. Personally, I like to be able to breathe and move after my meal so the portions were perfect. Especially with an appetizer. Bison burger w/ a BACON jalape√±o JAM.. WAT. Fresno FIG burger w/ a FIG MARMALADE and SPICY PORTER MUSTARD THESE ARE MY FAVORITE WORDS. I even threw a tomato dill soup on the side cause I'm bouji. Will return for the kimchi burger and the buco riblets! 

Big shout out to Lauren (I'm almost certain that's her name.. the body builder from Washington) for taking solid, personable care of us and the friendly host. Made it a lil vacation for my one day off. 

~My only suggestion/improvement is to make sure the silverware is polished a little better but otherwise massively impressed!
Pretty expensive for how little they give but very nice service and their drinks are great! Wouldn't go again because of the prices though. $30 for two appetizers is pretty steep.

Pete, Steve, Candice, Miriam, Kayla, Alex, Tressa and Sirus made my late lunch early dinner the best ever!!! These people are the nicest and most efficient group ever.  A individual passed out infront of the restaurant and Steve swooped in. Even after he got up and wonder  away Steve followed to make sure he was okay. The staff are great and they have paper straws!!! This is defintely an eco friendly place. And food was really good.  I'm am a local and I will defintely be back.

Opening day and it didn't disappoint! Service was amazing. The additional training support made it feel overstaffed but everyone was friendly and informative on the menu and general questions for a new place. 
I tried the corn dog lollipops and they were great, the spice mustard made it worth getting. We had the Mac n cheese balls- to die for. This could have been my meal. Haha
I enjoyed the Chicken Tacos. They were spicy, tangy and delicious. I would definitely get them again. 
For dessert we tried both. They were equally as good. Not overly sweet but satisfying. 
Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

I enjoyed the food.  It is what I would call, classic, upscale American fare with a trendy base.  Yeah, I made that up.  What it consisted of for us was short ribs, salad, mac and cheese, roasted brussels sprouts, and a burger. (No, not gluttonous, we all shared).

The food is well-prepared, and a bit inventive, almost Instagrammable.  The prices are a little high, but what you would expect for the downtown tourist area.  The service is a bit spotty where the wait staff is concerned (though the hosts/hostesses are awesome).  The place is hecka-noisy, at least on the day I came, so don't expect to hold a conversation (making this a possibly questionable proposition for a business "power" lunch).  

To me, the decor is way too hip...a bit distracting from the food, but it can be forgiven.
Food was very good, service great and the happy hour menu was a good value.  They have a good variety of beer on tap.

Ventured into Downtown Vegas last night and decided to check this place out. Eureka is tucked away on the corner of a convenient location on Fremont Street. There is patio seating open to Fremont, which is nice on these summer nights. The restaurant itself is centered around the bar, and most of the seating is around the bar as well (not the best place to bring kids). 

We only made it to the appetizers for our meal since we paired it with the beer flights. Here are my suggestions.

What to Get- Appetizers on Happy Hour Menu & Drinks:
Mac and Cheese Bites (cheesy and crispy and comes with a great dipping sauce)
Crispy Brussel Sprouts (light and crispy and tossed in a sweet sauce)
Beer Flights (any and all. fun addition to meal)
Falafel Bites (flavorful and comes with a great topping and Tzatziki sauce) 

I wasn't a huge fan of the truffle fries (larger cuts and not well seasoned). 

Overall, I was let down by the cocktails since the price and hype did not match up with the quality of drinks. I didn't enjoy my Young and in Love and my Electric Butterfly cocktail. I kept seeing these pictures on yelp and decided to give it a try. The Young and in Love was very sour and sweet and didn't have much depth. The Electric Butterfly comes with a buzz button (flower bud) that you chew in your mouth (which completely numbs your mouth and makes you heavily salivate). It was an interesting experience in itself, however the drink was 80% ice cube. I don't understand the purposes of the large purple ice cube, but I really only got 4 sips before the drink was gone. I also tried my friends' drinks- Moscow Mule and the Margarita, both better than the other cocktails but nothing very special. 

This is a fun spot and in a fun space. I'd suggest coming here for good beer and small dishes.

The bar of my dreams come to life. To start, 40+ beers available. All American, all craft. Nothing from the big guys. Great whiskey and bourbon list. Again, all American, all craft. Prices are super affordable, location is great, and atmosphere is excellent. The bartenders know their stuff and the cocktail list is creative but not silly (no flavored ice spheres to crack open, just well balanced delicious drinks). Food is dynamite, great place for small bites and a couple beers or cocktails, or to come for dinner and drinks or to watch the game. Seriously I loved this place and can't recommend it enough. My favorite bar in Vegas, big guys be damned.
It's the first day and they are off to a great start!!  Great service and awesome food and only 2 min walk from the Fremont Experience. Try it and you'll be hooked!!

This place was great from A to Z. Stopped here before heading home, ending off the bday season. Yes I said season. :-) Hehehe. My fiance and I had the beef marrow burger, truffle cheese fries, and subbed in the Mac and cheese balls since we had the truffle cheese fries. Can't say a bad thing about any of it! I also tried the beer flight and mimosa flight, nummers again! Ginger mimosa! (If you like ginger) Do it!  In your face flavor. Our waitress was super knowledgeable and as sweet as can be. Prices weren't bad either! Whether you live in town like myself or just visiting its definitely worth a stop. We will surely be returning. Thank you!

Oh, they also had a Make a wish event going on where they donated I believe 15% of the check. So that just kicked it over the top that they were supporting a good cause as well.

A M A Z I N G!!! Our server( wish I remembered his name) was awesome. We were on the fence about what to get and he was on point with all of his recommendations. The Brussels sprouts are on another level!!

Stopped for a late dinner with coworkers. We were not disappointed! Food was great! Many different choices. Great bar menu too. Shannon was our server. She was a great help with menu and drink suggestions.

Second day open and we give it 5 stars!  The service was incredible and the food came in the perfect time!  We split the Fig Burger (sooo good) and the Chicken Sliders with optional Mac and cheese balls (per recommendation of our waiter). All incredibly tasty. Glad we took the chance. Beautiful interior as well. We look forward to coming back to Eureka!

Got here just in time for happy hour, which included small plates and some adult beverage discounts. Walking in we were seated quickly in a booth towards the back. Besides indoor seating there's really cute seating out in the front! Ambience was super nice, really modern and really comfortable with nice lighting. 

I was EXTREMELY tempted to get the charcoal lemonade, but I chickened out. Cluck cluck. I ordered some water while my friends got some of the Maui Ale I think, they were definitely fans of how light it was. 

Our table ordered Mac and cheese balls, chicken sliders, and a couple burgers. Mac and cheese balls were decent, but I'd like to give a standing ovation to their sidekick, the dipping sauce. Tasting like a cheesy ranch, I was all in. The chicken sliders were decent sized and they opted for the sweet potato fries. Did y'all catch my rhyme? There were mashed potatoes in the sliders and my pals told me the spicy aioli was awesome sauce. The fries were sprinkled with cinnamon and what may or may not have been maple syrup. Forgot to ask my other friends what they thought of their burgers, but they both ate the whole thing so I have to imagine they were aight. I'll attach some pictures of them so you can feast your eyes. 

For dessert I ordered the bourbon barrel cake, and I was so disappointed with how dry the actual cake was! Reminded me of the bourbon cake at TGIF, just more expensive. 

Our server Mary was great, knowledgeable about the beers and quick and attentive. Overall cool place for a quick bite, I'll come back fa'sho.

What a great experience. We ventured over to Fremont from the strip for an afternoon/ early evening. Walked up and down once, happened upon Eureka! as dinnertime was approaching. One table left at the outdoor seating caught our eye. More than happy with our decision to stop. They have a few signature cocktails- including me fav, Moscow mule, but instead of ginger beer they make their own ginger syrup. Definitely good, but I miss the 'fizz'. List of ~40 beers to choose from, plus whiskey if you're into that. Brussels appetizer was worth it. I had the Fresno fig and goat cheese burgers with sweet potato fries, my husband had the 28 day aged burger, added onion straws and cheddar cheese, regular fries. If you can get a side of the truffle fry sauce to try, do it. Would recommend! Our server Tyler was so helpful and sweet. We definitely lucked out!

I was going to a program at the Historic Fifth Street School and I decided to try Eureka! before going to the show.  It was around 5 PM so the place was fairly empty except for the bar area.

I was seated quickly and my server, Dante, arrived and took my drink order.  When he returned, I ordered the bone marrow burger.  The burger is made up of shiitake bone marrow butter, charbroiled onion, mustard aioli, and a roasted Roma tomato.  Instead of fries, I opted for the $2 upcharge to have the fried macaroni and cheese balls--a smaller portion than what you get if you order it as an appetizer.

I asked for the burger to be very rare and that's the way it was served.  It was very good.  The fried mac and cheese balls are OK but another time I'd stick with fries.

Dessert was American chocolate budino with salted caramel, peanut butter whip and peanuts.  

Dante was a good server.  He was attentive and answered the questions I had.
This place is a gem!!! The food was amazing and the atmosphere is so hip! the only thing i didn't love was all the stuff in the bloody Mary... but the food was so amazing!!!

Food, service, whiskey, and beer selectionwe're great. Came in with my girlfriend for a 6pm dinner on a Friday night, and were seated immediately. It was a cool night, so their patio was great for sipping  a beer and people watching  while waiting for food. At first the copious tap selection and rotating whisky menu worried us that it was one of those downtown places that was more a bar than restaurant, but the food was great. As was our service, our waiter never let us have an empty cup. I had a steak sandwich with the Mac n cheese balls upgrade and both were better than par. Portion wise it was definitely less good food than more mediocre food, if that is important to you.

Such a cool and hip place to eat!!! We happened to be down here today when they were doing the ribbon cutting and it is an amazing place. Such fun and upbeat, the atmosphere of the restaurant is new and just full of life . The best thing so far on their menu is these lollipop corn dogs; they are magic in your mouth. So check it out.

Eureka! I found a place that has amazing burgers...checked them out on a sunday at lunch time with the BJJ BFF.....Oss

Eureka! Service: Our server was at the table immediately upon seating to let us know that mimosas and Bloody Marys were $5 currently, excellent.  He answered some questions we had about the burgers and was extra helpful with getting orders the kids would like.  I wish I had gotten his name to give him some props on Yelp, he was on it.

Eureka! Bomb Burgers:  The Mac n Cheese balls were perfect.  Fried perfectly so that the Mac n Cheese inside was still cheesy.  The Jalapeno Burger was delicious!  The fried egg, cheddar, bacon, jalapeno and chipotle sauce all worked well together for an amazing burger.  FYI, the sweet potato fries come extra sweet as they're served with a touch of honey.  My friends enjoyed their Bone Marrow Burger and their Cowboy Burger.  

Ambiance:  Very clean industrial decor with plenty of wood enhances the experience in the open dining area.  The bar is beautiful and well stocked.  This is an attractive restaurant

Two more things to wrap this up.  Eureka! has the best Bloody Mary I've had in a long time.  I'm not really into them, but these are made from scratch and it was so tasty I ordered a second one I didn't need.  The BJJ BFF left his wallet at the table by mistake.  We were walking towards container park and one of the employees came running over with the wallet.  Fantastic, we so appreciated the honest crew at Eureka!  The burgers are lovely and I'm looking forward to trying a new one every visit. 
 But that's another Yelp tale, Enjoy!

We were downtown for Mint 400 festivities and glad to see that Eureka was finally open. We didn't hesitate to give it a try. The place is beautifully designed... warmly contemporary and very welcoming.  The staff is very enthusiastic and excited about everything, so the service was terrific. 
I enjoyed the Napa chicken sandwich and thin-cut fries, and my companion loved his Cowboy burger, along with an "Atomic Duck" pale ale. The prices seem fair, which is nice to see in a town that loves "Strip" pricing no matter where they are!
Looking forward to visiting again soon to try other menu items.

Great little American bistro located right on Fremont Street.  Very cool interior vibe with a trendy cliental.  I don't recall the name of my burger but it was really good.  And that micro brew called Notorious from Boneyard Breweries was delicious.  I would definitely eat here again.

Heck of a craft beer bar. Food's not bad either. (OK, let's be honest: I enjoyed the food tonight far more than I thought that I would.)

Eureka! is chain focused on American food and beer that has set up shop in the Fremont East district of Downtown Las Vegas, just across the street from Commonwealth and El Cortez. They have what you might term "gastropub" food and a massive array of 40 taps, half of which are rotating draft beers (check their Instagram account for updates on those). They also have plenty of wines, liquors, and cocktails if you're not into beer.

Because I am into craft beer, I've visited this spot twice now. I can discuss the several beers which I've had at reasonable length, but that may not help you because I only recall having one "permanent" draft beer, the Knee Deep Brewing Company's Lupulin River. It's a "double" or "imperial" IPA, and it has a somewhat addictive hoppy taste with some piney and tropical notes. It grew on me as I sipped on it.

(In case you happen to read this review within a few days, get the Left Hand Chai Milk Stout or the Saugatuck Blueberry Maple Stout ASAP before they're tapped out. Those two manage to convey the promised smells and flavors quite successfully.)

I'll tell you some info that's more useful long-term though. They'll give little samplers (within reason) for you to try, and they have 4-beer flights for $9 (add $1 for each rotating beer). These options will help you to get a wide variety of tastes if you so desire. Just note that they designate certain beers with double exclamation marks ("!!") and exclude these beers from the flights, which makes sense because these beers tend to be pricier anyway.

As for food, I've had merely a few bites so far, none more delightful than the Bone Marrow Burger ($16.50). It's rather pricey for the portion size, but it somehow thrilled me with the bone marrow shiitake butter and the perfectly medium-rare, tender beef patty. It doesn't hit you with anything too bold, but maybe that's the "umami" aspect being carried out so well. The horseradish mustard aioli was subtle but really closed the deal.

I also enjoyed the Mac 'n' Cheese Balls (+$2 for 3 balls), which I substituted for the fries which would normally come with the burger. They're little "croquettes" but with cheesy pasta instead of potato, and they're mostly satisfying texturally more so than flavorfully. The accompanying beer cheese sauce is therefore quite useful for adding flavor here.

The Truffle Cheese Fries ($6 happy hour; by the way, that's 3-6pm and 10pm-closing, every night) are a preferable snack to accompany beer, or anything. Seemingly every bite has a touch of truffle flavor. The truffle cheese sauce wasn't that memorable, but that could've been the beer's fault.

Eureka! is a much-welcome restaurant for food lovers and alcohol imbibers alike. I'll definitely be back again and again.

This place had some hits and misses on our recent visit. The name suggests that the focus is on beverages, and our experience bore that out. I had two sour beers: Amicitia by Avery Brewing, and Revive Pineapple by Upland. The former was OK, not a lot of flavor beyond the sour, but a decent brew. The Revive had a deeper flavor and some sweet notes to complement the sour flavor. I'd definitely drink that one again. 

Moving to the food, we shared a number of dishes between our group of four; here's the rundown:

Crispy Glazed Brussels Sprouts - featuring an orange chile glaze, chimichurri, and almonds, these were really good, with a sweet flavor and a nice char. Probably the highlight of the meal. 

Mac and cheese balls - The beer cheese dipping sauce was probably the best part of this; they were nicely fried, but the mac and cheese itself was pretty basic. 
 
Lollipop corn dogs - Again, the mustard dipping sauce was tasty, but the product itself was pretty plain. 

Osso bucco riblets - These little bites did taste good and featured a tender meat with a nice aioli drizzle. Worth a try. 

Short rib kimchee burger - The kimchee was not very flavorful nor spicy, the patty was overcooked and a little dry, and the fries were about McDonalds quality, which is not bad for fast food, but I'd expect a bit more for these prices. 

Overall, it seems that Eureka is trying, and they did execute on some dishes, but for the prices, I'd have hoped for better quality. Having said that, myself and my group all agreed that the drinks were very good, and I think we'd all go there again for that.

Being Las Vegas locals, we rarely visit the Strip or Downtown Las Vegas, but my girlfriend had a taste for a bloody Mary one weekend. She did a search and Eureka came up with the results with the kind of drink she desired.

So we ventured to the east side of Fremont Street downtown and we are glad we did.
Great drinks (I like the Silver State Craft), good food, nice setting for people watching and friendly staff.

We highly recommend giving Eureka a try!
Loved it! Food was amazing, great service and the ambiance was very pleasant! Bloody Mary's $5 Saturday's and Sunday's!

The Fresno Fig Burger with the premium sweet potato fries was an awesome choice.  Paired with the cold brew made for a great lunch.   The hubs had the Cowboy burger with the ginger lemonade, which he enjoyed.  Will definitely eat here the on my next visit to Vegas.

Went to Eureka on Sunday night; we have been waiting for this place to open as they were taking a little bit time to fix this place. It was a very well done place actually! Super modern with decor and their menu. I think it's really hard to compete with everybody down here in freemont as there are so many really good restaurants down here. 

We actually only ordered the salmon; but man they didn't disappoint! Seasoning on Black rice and mushroom was so on point that if I put a dab of salt it will be too salty! Salmon was a perfect size and so flaky; it wasn't under nor over cook! It was literary perfect! Pink in the middle and glistening. 

I am a vodka person though unfortunately I think this bar is a beer bar and whisky so they only have a choice of house vodka! And that's a downer for me. I mean I just think every bar should have 2/3 choices of vodka. At least Tito and kettle one like the most popular brand. I usually only drink vodka soda and bad vodka make for a really bad hangover and that's exactly what happened. 

But hey other than that! Service was also on point! Never had to look for someone to get more drinks! They asked before your drinks were even gone! And that's what I call excellent service! 

Keep up the good work guys! Will be back soon!
Love the ambiance, love the food! The service was great too. They also have a good Happy Hour, which I always look for. My friend and I both loved it and can't wait to go back!

New Restaurant on Fremont St. Great vibes, staff and food!
We had a party of 8 and everyone loved their food and drinks!
I had the Steak sandwich - one of the best I've had. The salmon was great and my son is still talking about his Turkey Burger and of course the truffle fries- I would go back for just those!  Service was friendly - a great addition to downtown.

One of the best brunches I've had in a while. 

$5 Mimosas & Bloody Marys and a special brunch menu.

My friends and I checked this place out one Sunday evening and we were highly satisfied. We all ordered different things and every raved about how good the food was. 

I ordered the chicken & cornbread with bacon and OMG !!!!! it was good. I couldn't finish it all but it was delicious. My husband ordered the Steak and eggs and he loved it. It finished his entire meal and his favorite part was they potatoes. My friend ordered the veggie omelet and she loved the spicy sauce. We were all happy at the end of our meal.

Shout out to our amazing server Mary Ann, (I think her name is). She was amazing and she suggested great appetizers. I also love their cool Eureka shirts with unique sayings  on the back. 

Their full menu looks amazing as well and they have everyday happy hour from 3pm - 6pm  & 10pm - until. 

I will defiantly be back to partake in the deliciousness. Yum!

Thanks EUREKA, for an amazing Sunday Brunch.

I've been meaning to post a review from when I came in a few weeks ago, but just haven't been able to get to it. Went for the first time to visit this place about 3 weeks ago. Sat at the bar with some friends and had a very enjoyable time. We didn't order food, but we did get some drinks. I'm vegan and unfortunately didn't see an array of vegan options. They have a nice drink menu. Ashley was our bartender, whom I should add gave us wonderful service. We didn't really know what to order so she gave us suggestions based on what WE like, not what she liked. She asked us questions to get a better sense of our palate and went from there. She suggested some drinks after getting to know us a little bit and we were very happy with the overall service, the taste of the drinks and atmosphere. Will be returning soon, hopefully they'll add more vegan friendly foods by then.

Found by accident on a morning walk downtown, thought it seems like a good brunch spot and was certainly impressed. My group shared the Brussel sprouts and riblets as appetizers and I had the bread pudding French toast. Everything was excellent but I was most in love with the turmeric nectar I had as a drink.  The atmosphere was very nice and staff friend. This place is a gem.

I went to this restaurant earlier this week for a close friends birthday dinner and I must say that I'm so thrilled she chose this restaurant for her birthday celebration. I had seen a bunch of fellow yelpers check into this place and give it high reviews so I was super excited to see what all the hype was about. 

Eureka, you did not disappoint! Your food is phenomenal! 

Personally, I love going to restaurants with a larger group because everyone will order different items off the menu which helps me discover which items are the most scrumptious choices. Every single item we ordered was incredible. My taste buds were soooo happy! 

We started off with a round of appetizers including the shrimp ceviche, truffle fries with beer cheese sauce, and the osso bucho riblets. First off, our appetizers literally arrived within a few minutes after we ordered them. Talk about impeccable service! I was so impressed! As for the taste of these dishes, the ceviche was so refreshing with the perfect balance of shrimp, mango salsa, and a hint of guacamole to tie the whole dish together. I'd easily order this app every time I'd go to this location. Not to mention, the riblets were ever so tender with what appeared to be a spicy buffalo sauce on top. Now combine that with truffle fries and beer cheese and all you'll be able to say is yummmmmmm in between every delicious bite. 

As for our main courses, I ordered the jalape√±o egg burger with a side salad as a substitute for fries (since i already indulged in a heaping portion of fries in an appetizer a few moments earlier). Let me just tell you, the flavor of this burger combined with a sunny side egg on top was sooo delicious and savory. I scarfed up every bite within mere minutes. Plus, the side salad was the perfect compliment to end my meal leaving me completely satisfied and not too stuffed. The rest of our table ordered a wide array of dishes including the Napa chicken sandwich, bison burger, 8oz steak, and the steak sandwich. I can honestly say I saw smiles all around that table and each plate was completely empty which could only mean my guests were just as pleased with their food choices as I was. 

Eureka, hats off to your chefs on your amazing food as well as props to your servers for their incredible service.  We will definitely be back in the near future!

Awesome restaurant! They have completely opened up the space that was formerly the Downtown Beat.  Full of happy smiling people!  Our server, G (sorry cant' spell it) was so enthusiastic about the menu and the source of their beef.  I had to have a hamburger and was not disappointed.  The hard part was deciding on which one!  I had the jalapeno burger with a fried egg served naked (over delicious greens with a light dressing).  Amazing medium rare!  I ordered up the side for some delicious crispy sweet potato fries.  Unfortunately, I was unable to imbibe in one of their tap selections or whiskey.  Will be back to try the 28 day dry aged burger, beer and/or cocktails.  
You have got to try this new DTLV restaurant!

An oasis of good food and chill environment among the, let's call them "retro" eateries. We did realize that this was a chain when we decided to try it, but now we're glad because there's one jot far from our home!

We had a burger and the fish tacos, the kid had the corn dogs. All were fresh and flavorful. The corn dogs were not greasy at all. 

The decor is interesting and fun. And, best of all, they use paper straws! Yay!!
I love this place! It's a nice relaxing environment & in a great location. The food is really good & staff was polite.

Good food and great atmosphere. Service was great as well. We went and ordered off the brunch menu. Mac n cheese balls were awesome, as well as the steak and eggs and all of the drinks. Mimosas and bloody Mary's are $5 all day on Saturday and Sunday. Also, special mention for Barry, our server. He was very knowledgeable and made sure to check on us throughout our visit. We will defiantly be back.

For a new location they nailed!

The Mac and cheese balls are full of flavor and perfect size for an appetizer. 

I ordered the Fresno Fig Burger, it had a fig marmalade with melted goat cheese and bacon. I could eat that every day for the rest of my life! 

Service was awesome from start to finish, and they have a killer craft beer and whiskey selection.

Came in last Friday and there seemed to be all new bartenders. I was extremely disappointed. I came in right when they opened and was so blown away by the horrible service and I received a very nice message from the general manager inviting me back. The second time I came in was great, and now the third time it was back to pure disappointment. The blonde bartender on Friday night has an extremely dirty mouth and was very inappropriate. The guy seemed to not want to be there and I was ignored completely by the 3rd bartender. They seemed to be a little busy but I had ordered the falafel appetizer and it never came out. When I asked the bartender about it she told me "f*ck I forgot it ring it in" I paid for my 1 drink and left. I have given Eureka 3 shots and I'm done. There are too many amazing places on freemont to go to.
Awesome atmosphere, service, food and beer! Definitely will be back! The beer selection is amazing. I really like their support of local products.

D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S-! Went here for happy hour (3-6PM and another late night...maybe 10 or 11PM?) and the prices were pretty decent for shared appetizers. Let me tell you about the food and a special drink.....

We ordered Brussels sprouts (AMAZING!!!), mac n cheese bites (had a little kick), chicken nachos (the jalape√±os were hot), and the fries (the cheese and dip were delightful).

What stood out to me most was the Electric Butterfly cocktail. The waitress said that I picked the best drink of them all. Then my friend said she read a review about it in a magazine. They seemed both very excited about this drink that I picked out. I'm not sure why I picked it as I hate butterflies, but the description (posted a photo of it and the drink) looked superb so my tastebuds told my brain, "THAT ONE!" The buzz button definitely gave my mouth a strong tingling and numbing sensation, but for sure cleansed my palette a bit and the drink tasted even better after.....and so did my friend's drink called Rosemary's Ruby Red. Hahah. Even the taste of the Brussels sprouts after chewing the buzz button from the drink made them taste bold.

We chilled down with a couple of beers on their list. Seemed like you couldn't go wrong with whatever they had on tap.

We sat on the patio since the sun was peaking out, but as it got cooler, they turned on the patio ceiling heat lamps and it felt good. Sitting on the patio or by the window is a great choice if you like to be distracted or people watch the Downtown Las Vegas crowd. The inside of this location looks very ambient with their dim lights and I was loving the dropped lightbulbs on the colored wires.

The bar had TVs if you wanted to catch up on sports and such.

I will definitely return to try more items and cocktails. As for the price, got to make sure I share with friends as that bill can rack up quick because everything we ordered was so good! :)

Going restaurant/ full bar right on the corner of Fremont and 6th st... nice outdoor patio where you can enjoy a nice meal in this good Vegas weather. The bacon cheeseburger I ordered was very juicy and tasty. They have a wide variety of different burger that's their specialty. Good vibes here because they play good music as well.

We were instantly welcomed by the GM on a Friday night with a party of 6 we sat down immediately. Within 5 minutes we had waters, drink orders were in and they were taking our food order.  The drinks and the food were great, the service was outstanding. This place was needed on Fremont!

After walking around Fremont street we found this place and decided to stop by and grab a bite. The food was great very flavorful I had their chicken sliders which were very good crispy and spicy and very filling I also had their Wild child cocktail drink which was very refreshing and well put together.
Good place for everyone. Even our vegan friends have some options. Good location and prices. One of my favorite spots downtown for a group meal.

Great food, nice atmosphere and AWESOME  service from our server Shannen.  Large selection of craft beers.  Burgers were delicious.  Mac and Cheese balls are a must have!  Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!

I've been to one of their locations in Austin. I loved it there, so I was very excited to try the one here. Needless to say, Eureka a very welcomed addition to the area!

I ordered the crispy brussel sprouts, dry aged carrot fed burger and the Smokey cocktail. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection. The hostess and server were both very warm and welcoming. The experience was fantastic from start to end.

I don't eat very frequently downtown, as I live in the SW area of Vegas, but I will definitely be coming here again.

Just left now. They opened today and surprisingly it wasn't too busy. First off. I was super stoked to hear a Eureka was opening, second, the location is awesome. Right across the street from Common Wealth. The service was amazing. Dante made sure we were all taken care of. The food. AMAZING. Even my friends who had never been were blown away. I'm a huge craft beer fan, so this place gets more points for that. Huge selection. I feel like once word is out how great this place is, it'll start becoming busier. I'm excited to go back and try the brunch! :)
A delightful splash of sass as a much needed reprieve from the seedy underbelly that is Fremont street

This place is rad!  Couldn't decide between this spot or another down the street, so we stopped and looked at each menu.  Eureka's manager came out to see how we were...just looking at the menu.  Just having that extra touch right off the bat sold me. Sat at the bar and both bartenders(Troy and Heather) were super helpful and chatty.  Drinks were on point. Beer selection was vast and impressive. I'm from San Diego and Heather's knowledge of SD beers and spirits was crazy ;) it happened to be the GM who met us at the door...and he checked in on us frequently and made us feel right at home.  Food was delish and had a flare that isn't seen usually in bars. Then I was told that they have 2 locations in San Diego!  Guess my roots brought me here. :) I will def visit again when I'm back in town.

Amazement, astonishment, astoundment, and awe are all synonyms for Eureka!  Quite a lot of pressure to place on a business; thankfully it lived up to its namesake! 

Friendly and courteous staff to go with an outstanding beer selection of rotating guest handles as well as several local breweries represented.  Bartenders are efficient mixing cocktails and knowledgeable on the variety of beers on the menu.  Feel free to sample away.

The food I've enjoyed thus far has been:

 Glazed Brousell Sprouts 4.25/5 light and perfectly cooked.

Cauliflower Bites 4/5 nice flavor with a spicy kick

Chicken Nachos 3.75/5 fresh veggies, guacamole and a good choice of chips. 

Fresco Fig Burger 5/5:  one of the best burgers great patty, goat cheese and bacon.

Will definitely be back to try more food and the amazing beers.
 Silver State by Crafthaus being on the mainstay handle and priced at $4 in my go to!



Check it out and find the joy and euphoria that is Eureka!!

I'm sad to say this is my first low star review. Came in last night (Monday) and sat at the bar. It took a few minutes to even be acknowledged. Once the bartender came over he had such a smug attitude and instantly made me feel extremely uncomfortable. The other bartender continually cursed through the entire time we were there and that was beyond unappreciated. The beer list was extensive and amazing. We ended up not eating, but the menu looked great. I had the electric butterfly. Not the best cocktail in the world and when I ordered it the bartender yelled to the other one to grab the special ice cube. The entire time of us being there we felt that we were an inconvenience so we left after one round. We were very excited to try this new place downtown due to all the positive reviews but we will not be returning.

After finally getting through the drive we stopped in for appetizers and a drink before pressing on. I had a Moscow Mule and nachos. My better half had the truffle fries and a rum and coke. Ambiance, decor and food were truly terrific. Had we been in the area for dinner we would have gladly come back. Sadly we didn't have the opportunity this journey.
Ryan is awesome, very attentive amongst the Zappos madness!! The bone marrow burger was good too!
We ate here on their second night open and the food as well as the service were excellent! Definitely going to make this a new regular place to eat and take guests to while they're in town.

My room mate & I came here on Saturday night 8pm and were shocked to find out we could get seats right away (they do not take reservations). The food was great for both of us- pesto chicken sandwich and protein salad. We ordered French fries and Brussels sprouts as appetizers which came out quickly. Drinks were not very big but that's to be expected. The Young & In Love was sweet and would highly recommend (pictured). Definitely worth the trip downtown for!!!

This ain't no Johnny, Jim, Jack, or Jose kinda joint.  Eureka!  Well sortta.

Another entrant spurring on the revitalization of the DTLV Arts District.  On the corner of Freemont and 6th, it has everything you'd expect from "that" place.  Industrial chic interior, casual vibe, solid selection of rotating casks and brown libations, craft cocktails, and modern American bar grub.  

Dishes are drink friendly with bold flavors.

"Share It" dishes ordered were just OK.  The Mac N' Cheese balls (as the name implies, rolled in a parm bread crumb mixture and deep fried),  Crispy on the outside, warm, creamy and cheesy on the inside; slightly oily, solid.  The crispy glazed Brussels sprouts, OK, bitterness enhanced by the vegetal chimichurri but brightened by a somewhat sweet orange chili glaze.  Both work with drinks but neither stands alone.

Ready for your Eureka moment?  This is it, the bone marrow burger.  A thick, all beef patty (mixture of cuts not specified but taste like some dry aged cut is included), well cooked and finished with an umami supercharged bone marrow, shitake butter.  A horseradish aioli enhances the dry aged character of the beef, while a grilled roma tomato adds acidity.  The warm bun soaks up all that goodness...oh heck, it's good eats.

The butcher's steak dip (basic French dip) and bison burger with bacon jalape√±o jam also good but I wasn't gonna trade another sample of my burger for either.

Note:  Burgers can be served on a bed of arugula tossed in a lemon vinaigrette instead of in a bun. HAHA!

Service is casual and friendly. 

Very good beverage program.   Rotating selection (including seasonal) of 40 or so casks.  Rotating selection of brown libations.  Creative sounding cocktails though none sampled.  Prices are in line for DTLV.

Fills a niche and does it solidly.

We came in last night with a group of 8 and were seated right away. Got our drinks out quickly and appetizers were delish! We had Brussel Sprouts, Mac and Cheese Bites and Falafels, all super tasty.  Hubby had the bison burger, I had the naked American burger, 15 year old kid had the fried chicken sliders and adult kid had the Napa chicken sandwich. Others in the group had bone marrow burger, tacos and salad. We all enjoyed our dinners and the service was awesome. Would definitely come back next time in Vegas! Thank you Eureka for a memorable and delicious dinner!
Excellent restaurant with a main strip worthy menu at downtown prices. The blackened fish tacos were excellent.
Amazing burgers! Bone marrow burgers was awesome!!!! Reasonably priced and fun atmosphere.

Great food, awesome friendly staff, and great beers. Was in town for work and stopped by for lunch, it was a great experience. 

Highly recommend if you are looking for a spot to get a great burger and beer near Fremont street, the staff was awesome and super friendly as well. 

Will be back next time for sure.

Came in for drinks a few nights ago and loved it!¬† good vibe, great location, friendly staff, delicious drinks and amazing bites (okay i'll stop sounding like a commercial now).¬† I ordered (among other drinks) a smoked cocktail which paired well with the truffle fries (though in all honesty, I think anything would pair well with it).¬† Bartenders Ashley and Heather took amazing care of us and gave us the ins and outs of the cocktails & pairings.¬† I liked how the live music was kept at a reasonable level...I can't stand places where you have to yell at each other just to be heard.¬† Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely come back.¬† Eureka has been made a fine addition to the downtown bar scene.

Have I told u I found my new favorite place to eat fish tacos because they are that amazing yes downtown here blacken fish tacos are simply amazing ass well as special on beers happy hour  all the food looked amazing people seem nice and the stuff only being open a month and it's great can't wait to be back

Great food at a fair price , the Bison burger was very tasty and the shoestring fries were cooked perfect , there were 4 of us and everybody really enjoyed the food , they also have a nice selection of beer, something for every taste .
Roy , our server was fast and very friendly, he was a great addition to a wonderful meal, great service and great food .

I love the Eureka in San Luis Obispo. Excellent food, wine and service.  I expected the same at the Vegas location. We stopped in here for happy hour as we were bar hopping. They had a 50% wine special as it was Tuesday. Whoo-hoo! I love me some Justin wine! Our server started off polite but came by over  6 times  in 20 minutes to upsell us or suggest additional food items. Dude. Seriously. The restaraunt is almost empty and we just arrived. I could understand if it was crowded and we were taking up space or babysitting our drinks. We totally would have stayed to order more food/drinks but left due to not being able to enjoy an appetizer and drinks in peace.

Lot of hyperbolic reviews here. Let's get down to it. Double digit hamburgers have to be better than, or at least as good as, In-N-Out Burger. My 'Cowboy Burger' was a frozen hockey puck cooked well past my asked for medium rare. The accompanying shoestring fries are not drive-thru worthy. My wife had the salmon on top of some bland 'black rice.' The salmon was a generous cut and was fresh but did not have much in the way of added flavor from the kitchen. Maybe a grill of some kind is called for. 1 1/2 tablespoons of cole slaw was very good. A standard margarita was $10 with no salt on the rim. The draft beer was 12 ounces instead of a proper pint. The music was two clicks two loud with the tinny sound system making things much worse. Think one step up from AM radio. Stash a subwoofer or two someplace. Service was confused. Water not refilled... something that restaurants in the desert must get right. Dessert was a date nut cake so sweet you needed the vanilla ice cream to cut it. So you tell me who's writing all the 5 star reviews.
Wow - bone marrow burger , not sure about it but tried it from a review, best burger i have ever had ! Wow
The drinks are amazing and the food was delish! Our waiter was so helpful and kind. My new favorite restaurant in Vegas! The Electric Butterfly is the best drink I have ever had!

This place is awesome!  Fun craft cocktails and a HUGE draft selection. The  staff is very well versed on their craft. We had Bre, Ashley and Heather helping us.   My favorite on the cocktail list is "some like it hot". We also enjoyed the Brussels sprouts and corn dog lollipops. We really enjoyed our experience here. Thanks for a fun night and excellent food and service.

Scanned the menu and we were like fuckk they got a bone marrow burger here so we went as soon as it opened....we ordered:

Osso Buco Riblets - basically buffalo chicken wings but with pork riblets...good in flavor and interesting because I am not used to buffalo sauce on ribs...

Crispy Glazed Brussel Sprouts - It's up to par with a lot of my favorite brussel sprouts and that citrus glaze adds a twist to add more complexity to the taste

28 day (?) Carrot Fed Dry Age Burger -Yo this is fire and full of flavor..if you order this shit medium well or well done you are most def fuckin this burger up....order it like a steak, medium rare, and enjoy all the flavors that this patty has to offer...l

Bone Marrow Burger - This burger, just like the dry aged burger, is on another level...that bone marrow butter butter is so rich that its refreshing to have the onion and tomato cut through with freshness. I hate shitake mushrooms ever since I was a little kid and I didn't get a hint of that shitake taste or aftertaste in this burger....if this is available, get it! Top 50 burger dead or alive....

Bourbon Barrel Cake - basically a pancake in dessert form with candied pecans and ice cream...actually all pancakes should now be served with ice cream....

This is a great modern addition to downtown and what they did to that space is impressive...must try for sure

I came during a slow 1pm Tuesday but the beer staff and food were great. Their selection of seasonal craft beer was good and the food came out looking professionally prepared and tasted amazing. Our waitress was kind and kept our glasses full.

What a surprisingly fresh place on Fremont Street!!

Right away, all the staff was so friendly and welcoming!

The food was amazing and scratch made!!

The Mac and cheese bites were creamy and delicious, didn't taste frozen at all.
