The fried chicken sliders were perfect!!  Sounded strange with mash potatoes and coleslaw right on the sandwich, but it was delicious, especially with the firecracker aioli!!

My friend enjoyed the bison burger as well.

Highly recommended!!

The deviled eggs were a lot of fun. The horseradish taste was a bit too strong for me, but other than that? Delicious! 

The American cheeseburger was so tasty and juicy. It was my favorite. Nothing disappointed with this cheeseburger, especially because it comes with fries. 

For the dessert, we got the bundino and it was a great classic taste. A bit dry, but sweet nonetheless.

Went last weekend, and it's officially my new favorite restaurant. They have the most amazing selection of craft beers. My favorite is the Founder beer. The food was sooo good, even the healthy food. The atmosphere is fun with outdoor and indoor seating. The service was excellent!

Yes yes all of the yes!!!! It's all about eureka in old Vegas. This place was so awesome. They offer happy hour and late night happy hour. They offer weekend specials. I had a weird drink here...carrot juice...ginger...booze...it was very different, but good. The real star here is the food. They make all their sauces in house, including the ketchup and ranch. We got deep fried Mac and cheese (yum) and their burger with the bacon and the fig......oh em gee it was so damn good. Definitely give this place a try!!!

The decor and atmosphere is very nice.
Items that I love:
Osso Buck Riblets - great flavor with a nice touch of heat.
Crispy Glazed Brussels Sprouts - the glaze was yummy and sweet.
American Chocolate Budino - the peanut butter whip was amazing! I can eat it all day!

Items I like:
Short Ribs Kimchi Burger - I love kimchi so I gave it a try. And it was very good. The combination works.
Barrel Cake - it was nice but not as good as the Budino.

Item that I probably won't order again - Mac n cheese ball. It was just okay. I won't waste my carb and calories intake on this again.

I like  this place a lot and will definitely be back again.

For now Eureka! is only getting 4 stars, but I could definitely see this getting bumped up in the future. Why only 4 for now? Because I haven't had a chance to try their food, but it looks amazing!

We stopped in here on a Sunday afternoon after we had brunch at another nearby spot. We had immediately wished that we had brunch at Eureka!, but sat at the bar to have a few beers instead. If you are not familiar with this brand - they are a chain of craft beer centric gastropubs from California and a very welcome addition to East Fremont.

They have a phenomenal beer selection and a great cocktail menu too. The gentleman behind the bar (I didn't get his name, dang it!) was totally amazing - very friendly and engaging, even though he was slammed making endless bloody marys and restocking mixers. 

Anyhow, I look forward to going back to Eureka! very soon. They have a great selection of rotating taps, feature local beers and host fantastic events. I can't wait to try the food and hopefully bump this up to 5 stars! Cheers!

I went on national burger day ha ha so I had an excuse to order a hamburger, right? RIGHT! I couldn't decide between the bone marrow or the fig and the waitress said the fig was her all time fave. It was really good. It has this really great sweet and salt balance that I love with the bacon and the fig. I just absolutely loved it. The flavor was so robust and different. I would definitely come back. I did think it was loud inside...I came on Memorial Day at like 11 am...so I sat on the patio. Not too bad...but of course you get to watch the weirdos of Fremont. Hey, it makes for some great conversation and people watching. A thumbs up from me, give it a try.

This place is amazing! Our drinks were outstanding, the ambience is really neat, absolutely everything was fantastic. Great escape from downtown. I had the fig burger and promised myself I wouldn't eat the whole thing but that didn't work out well. It was too good!

Chill ass place ass place mates. Sat down with the dime piece, ordered the falafel bites and brussel sprouts for appetizers - both excellent, personally enjoyed the bsprouts a bit more. Steak sandy for the entree 10/10. Had 2 drinks each between the two of us as well and total came out to 72 bucks. Waitress was super chill, and dude playing guitar was a star in the making no joke.

New restaurant on Fremont St next to El Cortez. Fun, friendly and cool. I love the food and service. All the beer, wine and liquor made in USA. Love the True Myth Chard.
My favorite dinner is the salmon. Friends with us loved the turkey burger, chicken tacos and steak sandwich dip. Truffle cheese fries rocked. Cannot find a bad here and the drinks are terrific.

Young and in love cocktail was so good you could even eat the flower! Cauliflower bites were amazing as well as the sweet potato fries which was cinnamon on them and then are drizzled in honey. Also had the corn dogs which were yummy. The macaroni bites though were not good.

Hmmm... I wanted to come here because of all the compliments about the happy hour here.  I'm not impressed.  The best you can do is a $1 off specific beers?  Yikes.  The pricing on the happy hour food was ok but not spectacular.

We were there obviously at happy hour and this means we were there for shift change.  Maybe they shouldn't have sat us where they did but I just didn't like being privy to the complaints and gossip of the restaurant.  Do that in the back.  Don't let customers hear you complain.

The food was nothing special.  We ordered the falafel bites but they were out.  Didn't tell us until after we had gotten some of our food already.  Hmmm...

I will say the brussel sprouts were great.  A little oily but very delicious. 

Probably won't come back but that's ok.  Plenty of other great restaurants in the area.

We have had two fabulous lunches here. The glazed Brussels sprouts, Mac and cheese balls, and chicken nachos are all amazing off the app menu. My friends enjoyed the turkey burger and fish tacos. I've had the protein chopped salad twice and love love love it. Also, you have to try the homemade ginger lime soda. This is a great addition to the downtown food scene!

Terrific place.  Just opened this week and they got it right.  Had the Brussel sprouts and Mac n cheese balls and they were great.  Had the bison burger and it was great.  Also tried the "Electric Butterfly" drink and that was good too. Very good experience. Would come back and highly recommended.
